blocks.heading: En Ny Morgen
blocks.text: Solen står op over Eventyrskoven. Fuglene synger, og duggen glitrer. I mærker, at i dag bliver særlig.
blocks.gm_notes: Introduce roles and let each child say one fun detail about their hero. Keep it gentle and exciting.

blocks.heading: Borgmesterens Brev
blocks.text: En due lander med et brev. Der står: "Sky-slottets Smil er væk!" Uden smilet bliver dagen grå og stille.
blocks.gm_notes: Establish the quest. Ask: 'Why do you think the smile matters to everyone?'

blocks.heading: Feen Fnug
blocks.text: En lille fe med glimmerstøv siger: "Jeg hedder Fnug!" Hun peger mod skyerne. "Find Smilestjernen og bring den hjem."
blocks.gm_notes: Do a playful fairy voice. Ask kids what a 'Smilestjerne' might look like or sound like.

blocks.heading: Det Glitrende Kort
blocks.text: Fnug ruller et magisk kort ud. Tegnene danser som små lys. Kun én kan læse de glitrende ord.
blocks.gm_notes: Target the Wizard. Ask the Wizard to 'read' the map and describe the three route symbols. Optional: Roll a D6; on 4+ the map reveals a helpful hint.

blocks.heading: Ved Vejkrydset
blocks.text: I når et vejkryds med tre skilte. Et har en sol, et har et blad, og et har en fisk. Hvilken vej vælger I?
blocks.gm_notes: Choice Point #1. Have players vote. If they can’t decide, suggest Solstien for younger groups. Remind them all choices lead to a happy ending.

blocks.heading: Kage-duftende Eng
blocks.text: I kommer til en eng, der dufter af småkager. Blomsterne ligner cupcakes. Noget glimter i græsset.
blocks.gm_notes: Atmosphere moment. Ask: 'What cupcake-flower do you see?' Roll a D6; on 4+ they find a shiny button/coin 'heldeting'.

blocks.heading: Den Fniserende Bro
blocks.text: En lille bro fniser, når nogen går på den. Den siger: "Kun de modige går først!" Brættet hopper lidt som en trampolin.
blocks.gm_notes: Target the Knight. Ask the Knight to lead and say a brave phrase. No failure—bridge is friendly.

blocks.heading: Rævens Spørgsmål
blocks.text: En talende ræv med en lille hat kommer frem. "Jeg kan hjælpe jer," siger den. "Men vil I først hjælpe mig med min tabte klokke?"
blocks.gm_notes: Choice Point #2. Present two helpful options. Let kids vote. Emphasize kindness and teamwork.

blocks.heading: Frokost og Fnug
blocks.text: I holder en lille pause i skyggen. Fnug laver glimmer, der smager som saftevand. I føler jer klar igen.
blocks.gm_notes: Snack break prompt. Keep it short. Ask: 'What is your hero’s favorite snack?'

blocks.heading: Sky-trappen
blocks.text: I ser en trappe af bløde skyer op mod Sky-slottet. Trinene siger "puf" under jeres fødder. Øverst glimter en dør som perlemor.
blocks.gm_notes: Build excitement. Ask kids to make a 'puf' sound together as they climb.

blocks.heading: Sky-slottets Sal
blocks.text: I går ind i en sal af skyer. En venlig Skykæmpe sover og snorker små regnbuer. Smilestjernen ligger bag hans store pude.
blocks.gm_notes: Choice Point #3. Make it clear the giant is friendly and sleepy, not scary. Offer gentle solutions only.

blocks.heading: Smilestjernen
blocks.text: I får fat i Smilestjernen. Den er varm som kakao og lyser blødt. Hele salen bliver lidt mere farverig.
blocks.gm_notes: Celebrate. Ask: 'What color is the star today?' Target Wizard if they want to describe the magic.

blocks.heading: Tak, Skykæmpe
blocks.text: Skykæmpen vågner langsomt og smiler. "Åh! I fandt mit smil igen," siger han. Han hjælper jer ud på en regnbue-rutsjebane.
blocks.gm_notes: Keep it humorous. Ask kids to act out a giant yawn and a gentle 'thank you'.

blocks.heading: Byfest ved Solnedgang
blocks.text: I vender hjem med Smilestjernen. Himlen bliver blå, og alle griner igen. Der er saftevand, kage og en medalje til hver af jer.
blocks.gm_notes: Tie back to choices made. Ask each player what they are proud of. Great closing moment.

injects.heading: Sol på Næsen
injects.text: I går ad Solstien, og alt føles varmt og let. En sommerfugl lander på ridderens hjelm. Den peger med vingerne, som om den guider jer.
injects.gm_notes: Target the Knight. Ask for a brave-but-kind phrase. Keep it playful.

injects.heading: Sangblomster
injects.text: Blomsterne synger, når I siger "godmorgen". De lærer jer en lille rim-sang om venskab. I får et glitrende blad som held.
injects.gm_notes: Have everyone say 'godmorgen' together. The leaf can be a friendly 'bonus' later.

injects.heading: Hvisketræer
injects.text: I går ad Bladstien, og træerne hvisker søde hemmeligheder. Små glimmer-fnug på jorden danner et spor. Det føles som en skattejagt.
injects.gm_notes: Target the Ranger. Ask how they notice tiny clues. Optional: Roll a D6; on 4+ they find a bonus charm.

injects.heading: Egern-feen
injects.text: En egern-fe hopper ned og vinker. "Tak fordi I går stille!" siger den. Den giver jer en nødde-fløjte, der kan lave en glad lyd.
injects.gm_notes: Let kids try a quiet whistle sound with their mouths. This can help later with the sleepy giant.

injects.heading: Blad-regn
injects.text: Blade falder som konfetti. I griner og danser igennem dem. I føler jer lette og modige.
injects.gm_notes: Short energy boost. Ask kids to show a 'leaf-dance'. Then return to main story.

injects.heading: Hoppefisk
injects.text: I følger Fiskestien langs en lille flod. Små fisk hopper og siger "plop-plop" i bobler. En fisk viser jer en hemmelig genvej.
injects.gm_notes: This is a shortcut branch. Ask: 'Do you trust the helpful fish?' Emphasize it's friendly and funny.

injects.heading: Boble-portalen
injects.text: I træder ind i en stor boble, der føles som gelé. Den siger "boing" og "pling". Pludselig står I ved Sky-trappen!
injects.gm_notes: Make a 'boing' sound. This merges ahead, skipping some travel beats.

injects.heading: Spor i Græsset
injects.text: I leder efter klokken. Der er små mærker i græsset og et glimt ved en sten. Det ligner et spor, der vil lege gemmeleg.
injects.gm_notes: Target the Ranger. Ask how they follow the trail. Optional: Roll a D6; on 4+ they find it fast.

injects.heading: Klokken Finder Hjem
injects.text: I finder en lille klokke, der siger "ding-ding". Ræven jubler og bukker. "Tak! Jeg viser jer den bedste vej," siger den.
injects.gm_notes: Reward kindness. The fox can mention a safe shortcut or an easier bridge crossing later.

injects.heading: Rævens Smarte Sti
injects.text: Ræven fører jer på en sti, der svinger forbi de kedelige sten. I ser sjove sky-former på himlen. Turen føles kortere og rarere.
injects.gm_notes: Ask kids to name a cloud shape they see (e.g., dragon-shaped cloud but friendly).

branches.name: Gå Videre Nu (så hjælper vi senere)

injects.heading: Et Venligt Løfte
injects.text: I siger: "Vi hjælper dig senere!" Ræven nikker og smiler. "Så tag denne lille fjer som held," siger den.
injects.gm_notes: Emphasize keeping promises. The feather can be a 'magic reminder' later.

injects.heading: Hurtige Skridt
injects.text: I går videre med hurtige, stille skridt. Solen står højt, og I føler jer fokuserede. I ved, at I stadig kan være hjælpsomme.
injects.gm_notes: Ask: 'How will you remember to come back and help?' Tie into friendship theme.

injects.heading: Tryllesang
injects.text: Troldmanden nynner en blid melodi. Lyden er som varm te og bløde skyer. Skykæmpens snork bliver til små fnis.
injects.gm_notes: Target the Wizard. Invite a simple hum. No pressure—everyone can hum softly together.

injects.heading: Stille Fødder
injects.text: I går som katte med stille fødder. Puden glider lidt væk. Smilestjernen kan næsten nås.
injects.gm_notes: Ask each child to show a 'quiet step'. No failure; it’s a gentle success moment.

injects.heading: Et Lille Ding
injects.text: I tager Smilestjernen helt stille. Den siger "ding" som en lille klokke. Skykæmpen vender sig bare og smiler i søvne.
injects.gm_notes: Smooth win. Then merge back to the main 'Smilestjernen' block.

injects.heading: Fjer-kild
injects.text: I finder en lille fjer ved døren. I kilder Skykæmpens næse meget forsigtigt. Han siger "hatschi!" og fniser.
injects.gm_notes: Keep it silly and kind. No gross stuff—just a cartoon sneeze. Ask kids to do a tiny 'hatschi!' together.

injects.heading: Puden Flytter Sig
injects.text: Skykæmpen ruller lidt om på siden. Puden flytter sig, som om den hjælper jer. Smilestjernen ligger nu frit fremme.
injects.gm_notes: Ask: 'Who will grab the star?' Let any role shine, but keep it gentle.

injects.heading: Hvor Er Bamsen?
injects.text: I ser en kæmpe bamse i en sky-kurv. Kurven hænger i en snor, som siger: "Kun pæne ord åbner mig!"
injects.gm_notes: Ask each child to say one kind word. The rope loosens happily. Reinforce kindness theme.

injects.heading: Ridderens Blide Styrke
injects.text: Bamsen er stor og blød. Ridderen løfter den forsigtigt, som en pude. I andre hjælper med at styre den, så den ikke vælter.
injects.gm_notes: Target the Knight. Emphasize gentle strength and teamwork. No rolls needed.

injects.heading: Bamse-kram
injects.text: I lægger bamsen ved Skykæmpens arm. Han krammer den i søvne og siger: "Tak..." Smilestjernen glider frem af sig selv!
injects.gm_notes: This longer path merges ahead to 'Tak, Skykæmpe' (skips the separate star block). Keep it heartwarming and funny.

blocks.heading: A New Morning
blocks.text: The sun rises over the Enchanted Forest. Birds sing, and the dew sparkles. You can tell today will be special.
blocks.gm_notes: Introduce roles and let each child share one fun detail about their hero. Keep it gentle and exciting.

blocks.heading: The Mayor’s Letter
blocks.text: A dove lands with a letter. It says: "The Sky Castle’s Smile is missing!" Without it, the day turns gray and quiet.
blocks.gm_notes: Establish the quest. Ask: 'Why do you think the smile matters to everyone?'

blocks.heading: Fizz the Fairy
blocks.text: A tiny fairy with glitter-dust says, "I’m Fizz!" She points toward the clouds. "Find the Smile Star and bring it home."
blocks.gm_notes: Use a playful fairy voice. Ask kids what the 'Smile Star' might look or sound like.

blocks.heading: The Shimmering Map
blocks.text: Fizz rolls out a magical map. The letters wiggle like tiny lights. Only one of you can read the sparkly words.
blocks.gm_notes: Target the Wizard. Ask the Wizard to 'read' the map and describe the three route symbols. Optional: Roll a D6; on 4+ the map reveals a helpful hint.

blocks.heading: At the Crossroads
blocks.text: You reach a crossroads with three signs. One shows a sun, one shows a leaf, and one shows a fish. Which way do you choose?
blocks.gm_notes: Choice Point #1. Have players vote. If they can’t decide, suggest the Sunny Path for younger groups. Remind them all choices lead to a happy ending.

blocks.heading: Cookie-Scented Meadow
blocks.text: You arrive at a meadow that smells like cookies. The flowers look like cupcakes. Something sparkles in the grass.
blocks.gm_notes: Atmosphere moment. Ask: 'What cupcake-flower do you see?' Roll a D6; on 4+ they find a shiny button/coin 'good-luck thing'.

blocks.heading: The Giggle Bridge
blocks.text: A little bridge giggles when someone steps on it. It says, "Only the brave go first!" The boards bounce like a tiny trampoline.
blocks.gm_notes: Target the Knight. Ask the Knight to lead and say a brave phrase. No failure—bridge is friendly.

blocks.heading: The Fox’s Question
blocks.text: A talking fox in a tiny hat appears. "I can help you," it says. "But will you help me find my lost bell first?"
blocks.gm_notes: Choice Point #2. Present two helpful options. Let kids vote. Emphasize kindness and teamwork.

blocks.heading: Lunch and Glitter
blocks.text: You take a little break in the shade. Fizz makes sparkles that taste like juice. You feel ready again.
blocks.gm_notes: Snack break prompt. Keep it short. Ask: 'What is your hero’s favorite snack?'

blocks.heading: The Cloud Stairway
blocks.text: You see a stairway made of soft clouds up to the Sky Castle. Each step goes "poof" under your feet. At the top, a pearly door shimmers.
blocks.gm_notes: Build excitement. Ask kids to make a 'poof' sound together as they climb.

blocks.heading: The Sky Hall
blocks.text: You enter a hall made of clouds. A kind Sky Giant sleeps and snores tiny rainbows. The Smile Star rests behind its big pillow.
blocks.gm_notes: Choice Point #3. Make it clear the giant is friendly and sleepy, not scary. Offer gentle solutions only.

blocks.heading: The Smile Star
blocks.text: You carefully get the Smile Star. It feels warm like cocoa and glows softly. The whole hall becomes a little more colorful.
blocks.gm_notes: Celebrate. Ask: 'What color is the star today?' Target Wizard if they want to describe the magic.

blocks.heading: Thank You, Sky Giant
blocks.text: The Sky Giant wakes slowly and smiles. "Oh! You found my smile again," it says. It helps you out on a rainbow slide.
blocks.gm_notes: Keep it humorous. Ask kids to act out a giant yawn and a gentle 'thank you'.

blocks.heading: Sunset Celebration
blocks.text: You return home with the Smile Star. The sky turns blue, and everyone laughs again. There is juice, cake, and a medal for each of you.
blocks.gm_notes: Tie back to choices made. Ask each player what they are proud of. Great closing moment.

injects.heading: Sun on Your Nose
injects.text: You follow the Sunny Path, and everything feels warm and light. A butterfly lands on the Knight’s helmet. It flutters like it is pointing the way.
injects.gm_notes: Target the Knight. Ask for a brave-but-kind phrase. Keep it playful.

injects.heading: Singing Flowers
injects.text: The flowers sing when you say "good morning." They teach you a tiny rhyme about friendship. You receive a glittery leaf for good luck.
injects.gm_notes: Have everyone say 'good morning' together. The leaf can be a friendly bonus later.

injects.heading: Whisper Trees
injects.text: You follow the Leaf Path, and the trees whisper sweet secrets. Tiny glitter-fluffs on the ground make a trail. It feels like a treasure hunt.
injects.gm_notes: Target the Ranger. Ask how they notice tiny clues. Optional: Roll a D6; on 4+ they find a bonus charm.

injects.heading: The Squirrel Sprite
injects.text: A squirrel sprite hops down and waves. "Thank you for walking softly!" it says. It gives you an acorn whistle that can make a happy sound.
injects.gm_notes: Let kids try a quiet whistle sound with their mouths. This can help later with the sleepy giant.

injects.heading: Leaf Confetti
injects.text: Leaves fall like confetti. You laugh and dance through them. You feel light and brave.
injects.gm_notes: Short energy boost. Ask kids to show a 'leaf dance'. Then return to main story.

injects.heading: Bouncy Fish
injects.text: You follow the Fish Path beside a small river. Little fish jump and say "plop-plop" in bubbles. One fish shows you a secret shortcut.
injects.gm_notes: This is a shortcut branch. Ask: 'Do you trust the helpful fish?' Emphasize it is friendly and funny.

injects.heading: The Bubble Portal
injects.text: You step into a big bubble that feels like jelly. It goes "boing" and "pling." Suddenly, you are at the Cloud Stairway!
injects.gm_notes: Make a 'boing' sound. This merges ahead, skipping some travel beats.

injects.heading: Tracks in the Grass
injects.text: You search for the bell. There are tiny marks in the grass and a sparkle near a stone. The trail feels like it is playing hide-and-seek.
injects.gm_notes: Target the Ranger. Ask how they follow the trail. Optional: Roll a D6; on 4+ they find it quickly.

injects.heading: The Bell Comes Home
injects.text: You find a little bell that goes "ding-ding." The fox cheers and bows. "Thank you! I’ll show you the best way," it says.
injects.gm_notes: Reward kindness. The fox can mention a safe shortcut or an easier crossing later.

injects.heading: The Fox’s Clever Trail
injects.text: The fox leads you on a path that curves past the boring stones. You spot funny cloud shapes above. The trip feels shorter and nicer.
injects.gm_notes: Ask kids to name a cloud shape they see. Keep it whimsical.

injects.heading: A Kind Promise
injects.text: You say, "We will help you later!" The fox nods and smiles. "Then take this tiny feather for good luck," it says.
injects.gm_notes: Emphasize keeping promises. The feather can be a 'reminder token' later in the story.

injects.heading: Quick Steps
injects.text: You walk on with quick, quiet steps. The sun is high, and you feel focused. You still want to be helpful when you can.
injects.gm_notes: Ask: 'How will you remember to come back and help?' Tie into friendship theme.

injects.heading: A Magic Hum
injects.text: The Wizard hums a gentle tune. The sound feels like warm tea and soft clouds. The Sky Giant’s snore turns into tiny giggles.
injects.gm_notes: Target the Wizard. Invite a simple hum. Everyone can hum softly together—no pressure.

injects.heading: Quiet Feet
injects.text: You walk like cats with quiet feet. The pillow slides a little. The Smile Star is almost within reach.
injects.gm_notes: Ask each child to show a 'quiet step'. No failure; it’s a gentle success moment.

injects.heading: A Tiny Ding
injects.text: You carefully take the Smile Star. It goes "ding" like a little bell. The Sky Giant only rolls over and smiles in its sleep.
injects.gm_notes: Smooth win. Then merge back to the main 'The Smile Star' block.

injects.heading: Feather Tickle
injects.text: You find a tiny feather near the door. You gently tickle the Sky Giant’s nose. It goes "achoo!" and giggles.
injects.gm_notes: Keep it silly and kind. Ask kids to do a tiny 'achoo!' together.

injects.heading: Pillow Moves
injects.text: The Sky Giant turns to the side. The pillow moves as if it wants to help you. The Smile Star is now easy to reach.
injects.gm_notes: Ask: 'Who will grab the star?' Any role can shine here.

injects.heading: Where Is the Bear?
injects.text: You spot a giant teddy bear in a cloud basket. The basket hangs on a rope that says, "Only kind words open me!"
injects.gm_notes: Ask each child to say one kind word. The rope loosens happily. Reinforce kindness theme.

injects.heading: The Knight’s Gentle Strength
injects.text: The teddy bear is huge and fluffy. The Knight lifts it carefully like a pillow. The others help steer it so it does not tip over.
injects.gm_notes: Target the Knight. Emphasize gentle strength and teamwork. No rolls needed.

injects.heading: Teddy Hug
injects.text: You place the teddy bear by the Sky Giant’s arm. It hugs the bear and whispers, "Thanks..." The Smile Star slides out all by itself!
injects.gm_notes: This longer path merges ahead to 'Thank You, Sky Giant' (skips the separate star block). Keep it heartwarming and funny.

inject_library.heading: En Ny Morgen
inject_library.text: Solen står op over Eventyrskoven. Fuglene synger, og duggen glitrer. I mærker, at i dag bliver særlig.
inject_library.gm_notes: Introduce roles and let each child say one fun detail about their hero. Keep it gentle and exciting.

injects.heading: Hvisketræer
injects.text: I går ad Bladstien, og træerne hvisker søde hemmeligheder. Små glimmer-fnug på jorden danner et spor. Det føles som en skattejagt.
injects.gm_notes: Target the Ranger. Ask how they notice tiny clues. Optional: Roll a D6; on 4+ they find a bonus charm.

injects.heading: Egern-feen
injects.text: En egern-fe hopper ned og vinker. "Tak fordi I går stille!" siger den. Den giver jer en nødde-fløjte, der kan lave en glad lyd.
injects.gm_notes: Let kids try a quiet whistle sound with their mouths. This can help later with the sleepy giant.

injects.heading: Blad-regn
injects.text: Blade falder som konfetti. I griner og danser igennem dem. I føler jer lette og modige.
injects.gm_notes: Short energy boost. Ask kids to show a 'leaf-dance'. Then return to main story.
